images.caption: Figure 1:Summary leaderboard of state-of-the-art (SOTA) MLLMs on M3-Bench (higher is better).

Figure 3:Benchmark trajectory generation and judging pipeline.
The Executor plans tools, executes calls with controlled multi-threaded execution, and summarizes; the Judge reconstructs an optimal trajectory and verifies correctness. wherecℓ,nℓc_{\ell,n_{\ell}}denotes thenℓn_{\ell}-th tool call in stepℓ\ell.

Figure 4:Overview of MCP server ecosystem used in the M3-Bench. Category distribution of MCP servers; and tool distribution across servers. The inventory follows the MCP design and public specification.

Figure 5:Overview of our structure-sensitive metrics. whereSℓ⋆S^{\star}_{\ell}andS^ℓ^\widehat{S}_{\hat{\ell}}denote the sets of calls in the ground-truth stepℓ\elland the predicted stepℓ^\hat{\ell}, respectively, andcℓ,nℓ⋆⋆c^{\star}_{\ell,n^{\star}_{\ell}}andc^ℓ^,nℓ^\hat{c}_{\hat{\ell},n_{\hat{\ell}}}denote thenℓ⋆n^{\star}_{\ell}-th ground-truth call in stepℓ\elland thenℓ^n_{\hat{\ell}}-th predicted call in stepℓ^\hat{\ell}.
Table 2:Cross-Model Evaluation of Multimodal MCP Tool-Calling Trajectories: Detection, Trajectory Alignment, and LLM-Judge Metrics, The average score results correspond toFigure 1.
